alert.note: Alert for Wilson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 26 at 11:34AM CDT until October 26 at 3:15PM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: .Ongoing heavy rainfall is already leading to reports of urban and small stream flooding in eastern Bexar County. Some areas could still see an additional 1-2.5 inches of rain and additional minor flooding impacts will be possible over the next 1-3 hours. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Atascosa, Bexar, Guadalupe and Wilson. * WHEN...Until 245 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1132 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, Schertz, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Pleasanton, Selma, Jourdanton, Poteet, Stinson Municipal Airport, Randolph AFB, Kirby, McQueeney, St. Hedwig, Elmendorf, China Grove, Marion, Santa Clara and New Berlin. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
